modules.description: This module enables managing concurrent HTTP transfers through a multi-handle stack, supporting operations like adding or removing individual transfers, controlling I/O activity, and retrieving completed transfers. It works with multi-stack (`mt`) and transfer (`Curl.t`) data structures, offering configuration options for connection limits, pipelining, and multiplexing. Designed for integration with external event loops, it suits high-performance scenarios requiring asynchronous handling of numerous simultaneous transfers, such as web scrapers or HTTP servers.

This module provides operations for configuring network requests, managing data transfers, and handling security settings for protocols like HTTP, FTP, and SSH. It works with types such as CURL handles (`t`), protocol-specific enumerations (e.g., SSL versions, authentication methods), and configuration options (e.g., timeouts, proxies, callbacks) to enable tasks like secure file transfers, concurrent asynchronous requests, and fine-grained control over network behavior. Specific use cases include implementing HTTP clients with custom headers, resumable FTP uploads with TLS, and multiplexed transfers using the `Multi` submodule for parallel I/O operations.
